arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients age >75 y who underwent open hear surgeary
arm_group.description: The cohort study consist of all patients > 75 y, undergoing open heart surgery between 2008-2011 at Hadassah medical center.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purposes of the investigators study is to examine the overall survival and quality of
      life in elderly patients (> 75 years) undergoing open heart surgery at Hadassah medical
      center between 2008-2011. All alive patients will be phone interviewed using the 36-item
      short form health survey. Results will be compared to similar health survey results
      (36-SF)obtained from a group of Israeli adults who had no open heart surgery (controlled
      group). The investigators hypothesize that elderly patients achieve improvement in quality
      of life after open heart surgery with acceptable operative morbidity and mortality.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mid-term Survival and Quality of Life of Elderly Patients Undergoing Open Heart Surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  all patients age > 75 years who discharged alive after surgery

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  death

study_pop.textblock:
All patients age >75 y who underwent open heart surgery between 2008-2011 at hadassah
        medical center.

intervention.arm_group_label: Patients age >75 y who underwent open hear surgeary

clinical_study.official_title: Mid -Term Survival and Quality of Life of Elderly Patients Undergoing Open Heart Surgery
